section1.title: 1. Who is responsible for processing your data?

content.p1: The data controller of the personal data collected through the Ribotflow platform is {companyName}, with VAT number {companyVat}, registered address at {companyAddress}, and contact email {companyEmail}.

section2.title: 2. What data do we process and for what purpose?

content.p1: We collect and process different types of personal data depending on your interaction with Ribotflow:
content.item1: Identification and contact data (name, surname, email, phone number) that you provide during registration or when contacting us.
content.item2: Professional data (company name, job position) if provided.
content.item3: Data you enter into the platform about your own clients, suppliers, invoices, quotes, opportunities, expenses, and other business management activities.
content.item4: Technical and usage data (IP address, browser type, pages visited, usage time) automatically collected for the operation and improvement of the service.
content.item5: Billing and payment data (if paid subscription plans apply).
content.p2: The main purposes of data processing are:
content.purpose1: To provide, manage, and maintain the Ribotflow service.
content.purpose2: To communicate with you regarding service-related matters, technical support, or administrative information.
content.purpose3: To improve the platform, analyze usage, and develop new features.
content.purpose4: To ensure the security of the platform and prevent fraud.
content.purpose5: To comply with our legal obligations.

section3.title: 3. What is the legal basis for processing?

content.p1: The legal basis that allows us to process your data depends on the purpose:
content.basis1: The execution of the service contract that you accept upon registering and using Ribotflow.
content.basis2: Your explicit consent for specific purposes, such as sending marketing communications (if applicable).
content.basis3: Our legitimate interest in improving the service, ensuring security, or managing inquiries.
content.basis4: Compliance with applicable legal obligations (e.g., billing).

content.p1: It is important to note that regarding personal data of your own clients, suppliers, or third parties that you enter and manage within Ribotflow (such as names, emails, billing data, etc.), you act as the Data Controller. We act solely as the Data Processor, following your instructions and processing such data exclusively to provide the contracted service.
content.p2: Our obligations as Data Processor are detailed in the [Terms and Conditions of Service](link), which include the Data Processing Agreement (DPA) required under the GDPR.

section5.title: 5. With whom do we share your data?

content.p1: We do not sell or rent your personal data. We only share it with third parties when necessary to provide the service or to comply with legal obligations:
content.item1: Technology service providers: we use {provider} as our cloud infrastructure provider (database, authentication, storage).
content.p2: Some of these providers may be located outside the European Economic Area, but we ensure that adequate safeguards are in place to guarantee an equivalent level of data protection (e.g., Standard Contractual Clauses).

section6.title: 6. How long do we retain your data?

content.p1: Your personal data will be retained for as long as your Ribotflow account remains active and, thereafter, for the legally required period to address any potential liabilities.

section7.title: 7. What are your rights and how to exercise them?

content.p1: You have the right to access, rectify, erase your data, as well as to restrict or object to its processing, and to data portability, as established by current legislation.
content.p2: You can exercise these rights by sending an email to {email} and attaching a copy of your ID document.
content.p3: You also have the right to file a complaint with the Spanish Data Protection Agency (www.aepd.es) if you believe your rights have not been properly addressed.

content.p1: We implement appropriate technical and organizational security measures to protect your personal data against loss, unauthorized access, or unlawful processing.
We may modify this Privacy Policy from time to time. Any changes will be published on this page and, if significant, we will notify you by email or through the platform.

It allows the website to remember your actions and preferences (such as login, language, font size, and other display preferences) over a period of time, so you donâ€™t have to re-enter them each time you return or navigate from one page to another.
